titleStmt.title: Letter from William F. Cody to Samuel Stone "Buckskin Sam" Hall, September 9 [1879]

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

notesStmt.note: The year 1879 is determined by Buffalo Bill Combination performance dates and venues inscribed by Cody on Page 4 (Reference: 2008 Sagala, p. 236). "MSS" likely refers to an unidentified manuscript.

bibl.author: Cody, William Frederick, 1846-1917
bibl.title: Letter from William F. Cody to Samuel Stone "Buckskin Sam" Hall

msIdentifier.repository: McCracken Research Library, Buffalo Bill Center of the West

div1.p:
You are terriablyterribly up a stump. and I am realyreally sorry for you. You make liberal propositions. but please to understand that I am carrying to many people now, and Hotel and Rail roads are expensive. I cant send Ingraham away as he has arranged his business to go. Sam I will wait a day or Two and see how business is and if I can send for you will do so. But old fellow I fear the Texas Boys would keep you full all the time and
that would hurt my business. When you come on to New York. when I spoke to about going. if you remember. you said you could go if it would be a help to me I told you then not to go if you did not want to as it was no help to me as I could get plenty of men who wanted to go. You spoke as if it was doing me a great favor to go. You did not appear at all anxious. Then you instedinstead of going to Wilmington. you got on a drunk. Your business is not so very important that it should require you several days to get ready. Sam realyreally I dontdon't think we could
Saint James Hotel
agree. I am all business and I would expect a man to be prompt and reliable agreeable and quick to understand. I will try and help you out of your financial trouble. but just at present I am presedpressed my self. if I can send for you I will.
Never mind the money I gave you in New York ThatsThat's all O.K.
Ingraham wrote you about the MSS. Now old fellow beleivebelieve me

back.note: Note 1: Cody did not include the year in this letter's dateline, but the listing of dates and places on page 4 matches known performances of the Buffalo Bill Combination during the 1879 season.
